channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bloced drain, 20th February
item.description:
The drain by the substation, between 17, 24 and 24 Wellington Lane. This was blocked after works was carried out to repair a mains leak in November, resulting in silt build up in the drain. With the recent bad weather this can cause minor flooding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Wellington Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tons of holes and uneven crumbling ground, 20th February
item.description:
PLEASE do something about this road. Properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lipson road is a disgrace, 20th February
item.description:
ALL of Lipson Road. Just go take a look! Its been like it for a good 5 years - bodge jobs are done and it crumbles within days. Whilst you're at it, head to Village Road too - how is that even allowed to be driven on?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Lipson Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A sizeable pot hole in the middle of the road., 20th February
item.description:
I went through this pothole , see photo , and as it was dark and filled with rain water did not see it and my tyre burst instantly It has cost me 82 pounds to get it changed when they are new tyres. I would like some kind of compensation for this as this has been reported already ( as I can tell from the council website).and nothing has been done. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop flag missing, 20th February
item.description:
There is a bus stop dead opposite henley road however there has not been a flag for many years. Lots of bus drivers are saying that there isn’t a stop here. Please can a bus stop flag be put back up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springbank Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many potholes, more potholes than road, 20th February
item.description:
Entire of the road between the traffic light/pedestrian lights and the turning to Pilgrove way I think it is, a massive sequence of potholes, seems to have been reported multiple times and nothing is being done - so so dangerous!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham

item.title: Very deep pothole - blowing out tyres, 20th February
item.description:
I can’t be more specific as had to stop further up. Extremely deep pothole. Blew out my tyre - had to call RAC. Needs fixing urgently. Unsafe and not easy to see it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-9, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Gully blocked, 20th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Marle Hill Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocked drain and muddy water coming onto road by bridge on Albert Road, 20th February
item.description:
Near to bridge on Albert Road and Lakeside properties the drain is blocked with mud. This seems to happen every 3 to 6 months after it's been unblocked. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The temporary traffic lights have been left on Mill Lane, Brockworth despite the roadworks being finished. As it is near the sports clubs this will create havoc over the weekend Please can you arrange for them to be removed urgently Thank you, 20th February
item.description:
Good afternoon The temporary traffic lights have been left on Mill Lane, Brockworth despite the roadworks being finished. As it is near the sports clubs this will create havoc over the weekend Please can you arrange for them to be removed urgently Thank you Jill Jill Durnell Chair of Perrybrook Residents Association
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor
